Topic.Title: Nemo,face it, you don't even know or understand the simplest of making long term shorts foam at the mouth

Message.Msg: "The answer is that it depends upon the underlying cost drivers." Translation: nanotechU's previous claim was not true. Spending ratios have gone down before and not as many of the recurring expenses recur as often as claimed. "with something that was only 2% of sales" In a word it's all about L-E-V-E-R-A-G-E. Don't you see?. That's the whole beauty of Amazon's business model and management of these cycles. Such a tiny investment generating such huge returns. With only that much of a temporary acceleration of investment ratio. Those investments helped annual sales to triple by Year 5 and produce return in that year alone equal to 13% of those annual sales. Also impressive returns in Years 3 and 4 for that matter and even beyond Year 5. So it isn't simply slowing spending, spending will continue to rise in fact, just not by as much as a % of sales, but the quality of the returns they bring.

Topic.Title: Nemo,face it, you don't even know or understand the simplest of making long term shorts foam at the mouth

Message.Msg: You are a moron through and through. First, let's be clear about Amazon's FCF. "Free cash flow has limitations due to the fact that it does not represent the residual cash flow available for discretionary expenditures. For example, free cash flow does not incorporate payments made on capital lease obligations or cash payments for business acquisitions. Therefore, we believe it is important to view free cash flow as a complement to our entire consolidated statements of cash flows." Amazon's definition of FCF IS NOT discretionary FCF. Amazon's cash is encumbered and those issues listed in the disclaimer are far from comprehensive... Second, here is the FCF by year according to Amazon's metric: 2008 1364 2007 1181 2006 486 2005 529 2004 477 Check your math.

Topic.Title: Nemo,face it, you don't even know or understand the simplest of making long term shorts foam at the mouth

Also tell us what happens to someone who re-shorted at $244 as you claim to have done. Does he get a margin call? Does he close his short for a whopping loss and quietly disappear from the message board? What happens?
